instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won?t turn on on battery, won?t turn off with charger
threads.message:
MacBook had liquid damage.
Tested with two 100% working batteries.
Once OS boot battery is visible, its show % of charge and charger charge battery without any problem.

WITH BATTERY
When short <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> not no fan spin.
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> got stable 3.40V when got fan spin.
<RESISTOR>R5710</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5070</RESISTOR> got correct resistance.

When I connect charger got fan spin/chime etc but when short <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> then no fan spin but after 1 second it turns on again.
When I disconnect charger got still fan spin and when will do short on <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is turned off but can turn on with <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.

CHARGER ONLY
Fan spin when short <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> after a second got fan spin again.


Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won?t turn on on battery, won?t turn off with charger
threads.message:
Does it start itself when charger is connected (no battery)?

Disconnect keyboard and simulate power button with <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads.
Still the same issues?

On battery only, do you get stable <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won?t turn on on battery, won?t turn off with charger
threads.message:
Does it start itself when charger is connected (no battery)?
Yes

Disconnect keyboard and simulate power button with <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads.
Still the same issues?
I was testing without keyboard. Was using pads on keyboard (<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and GND)

On battery only, do you get stable <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>?
Yes, stable at 3.44V
